authentication.notes: API keys should be used server-side only and never exposed in client-side JavaScript

chatAgent.name: Chat Agent API
chatAgent.description: Primary chat endpoint with streaming, multimodal support, and advanced agent capabilities

parameters.name: conversationId
parameters.description: UUID to maintain chat context; change to start new conversation

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: User query (2-500 chars; 8K tokens/32k chars when authenticated)

parameters.name: context_items
parameters.description: Sources for retrieval; context boost uses 16

parameters.name: image_urls
parameters.description: Image URLs for multimodal context (requires compatible models)

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Override bot model (requires OpenAI API key)

parameters.name: default_language
parameters.description: Locale code for unclear language detection

errorCodes.description: Rate limit or team quota exceeded

chatLegacy.name: Chat API (Legacy)
chatLegacy.description: Legacy chat endpoint - use Chat Agent API instead

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: Query text (2-500 characters, or unlimited when authenticated)

parameters.name: full_source
parameters.description: Include complete source content in response

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: User identification data; keys like 'referrer', 'email', 'name' appear in logs

parameters.name: context_items
parameters.description: Number of source results to retrieve (context boost: 16)

parameters.name: autocut
parameters.description: Organize results into groups; returns top N groups

streamingChatLegacy.name: Streaming Chat API (Legacy)
streamingChatLegacy.description: Legacy WebSocket streaming endpoint - use Chat Agent API with stream parameter instead

parameters.name: question
parameters.description: The question to ask the bot. 2 to 2000 characters.

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: The API key. Required only for private bots.

parameters.name: full_source
parameters.description: Whether to return complete source content

parameters.name: context_items
parameters.description: Number of sources to retrieve (boost uses 16)

messageTypes.description: Final response with full answer and sources

conversationSummarize.name: Conversation Summarize
conversationSummarize.description: Generate summary, title, and sentiment analysis for a conversation (Chat Agent API only)

response.title: Short title of the conversation, one short sentence maximum

errorCodes.description: Feature requires Standard plan or higher

conversationTicket.name: Conversation Ticket Creation
conversationTicket.description: Generate support ticket subject and message from conversation (Chat Agent API only)

pathParameters.name: conversationId
pathParameters.description: Identifies the conversation for ticket generation

response.subject: Support ticket subject line
response.message: Detailed ticket content from the point of view of the user

conversationLead.name: Conversation Lead Capture
conversationLead.description: Capture lead information associated with a conversation

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Key-value pairs containing lead information. Can include any fields

answerRating.name: Answer Rating
answerRating.description: Record user satisfaction feedback for an answer

supportEscalation.name: Support Escalation
supportEscalation.description: Log when a user escalates a chat to human support

semanticSearch.name: Semantic Search
semanticSearch.description: Search bot's knowledge base using hybrid semantic and keyword search

parameters.name: top_k
parameters.description: The number of source chunks to return

parameters.name: autocut
parameters.description: Autocut results to num groups. Organizes results by distance jumps.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: Balance between keyword (0) and semantic (1) search components

parameters.name: use_glossary
parameters.description: Use the bot's glossary for term replacement

teamsList.name: List Teams
teamsList.description: Get all teams accessible to the authenticated user

teamGet.name: Get Team
teamGet.description: Get details for a specific team

teamMembersList.name: List Team Members
teamMembersList.description: Get all members of a team

teamMemberRemove.name: Remove Team Member or Invite
teamMemberRemove.description: Remove a team member or pending invite

parameters.name: removeUserId
parameters.description: User ID to remove (one of removeUserId or removeUserEmail required)

parameters.name: removeUserEmail
parameters.description: User email to remove (one of removeUserId or removeUserEmail required)

teamMemberInvite.name: Invite a Team Member
teamMemberInvite.description: Send an invitation to join the team

teamInviteRespond.name: Respond to an Invite
teamInviteRespond.description: Accept, deny, or retry a team invitation

botsList.name: List Bots
botsList.description: Get all bots in a team

botGet.name: Get Bot
botGet.description: Get details for a specific bot

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Shown by default in embeds and share links

sourcesList.name: List Sources
sourcesList.description: Get all sources for a bot

sourceGet.name: Get Source
sourceGet.description: Get details for a specific source

sourceCreate.name: Create Source
sourceCreate.description: Add a new data source to a bot

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Required for url, sitemap, youtube, rss types

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Required for urls, csv, document, wp types (cloud storage path)

parameters.name: faqs
parameters.description: Required for qa type; format: [{question:'text', answer:'text'}]

uploadUrl.name: Upload Presigned URL
uploadUrl.description: Get presigned URL for file uploads

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. Pages are 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of questions to return per page

parameters.name: couldAnswer
parameters.description: Filter by bot's capability to answer

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: A parsable datetime string like '2023-10-01' or '2023-09-29T15:12:46.335Z'

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: A parsable datetime string like '2023-10-01' or '2023-09-29T15:12:46.335Z'

questionDelete.name: Delete Question
questionDelete.description: Soft delete a question (flagged as deleted, content cleared)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. Pages are 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of conversations to return per page

conversationGet.name: Get Single Conversation
conversationGet.description: Get complete conversation details including message history

conversationDelete.name: Delete Conversation
conversationDelete.description: Delete a conversation permanently (requires edit permissions)

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Filter by lead createdAt start time (ISO datetime or parsable date)

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Filter by lead createdAt end time (ISO datetime or parsable date)

webhooksList.name: List Webhooks
webhooksList.description: Get all webhooks for a bot

webhookGet.name: Get Single Webhook
webhookGet.description: Get details for a specific webhook

researchJobsList.name: List Research Jobs
researchJobsList.description: Get all deep research jobs for a bot

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number to return. Pages are 0-indexed.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: The number of jobs to return per page

researchJobGet.name: Get Research Job Details
researchJobGet.description: Get details for a specific research job

botStats.name: Get Bot Statistics
botStats.description: Get analytics and performance statistics for a bot

parameters.name: timeDelta
parameters.description: The time period in days to analyze. Common values: 7 (week), 30 (month), 90 (quarter), 365 (year)

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start of date range (ISO 8601 or YYYY-MM-DD). Must be provided together with endDate

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End of date range (ISO 8601 or YYYY-MM-DD). Must be provided together with startDate

botStats.notes: Either timeDelta OR both startDate and endDate should be provided. If explicit dates are valid, they take precedence; otherwise falls back to timeDelta (defaults to 30 days).

botReports.name: Bot Reports (Monthly)
botReports.description: Get monthly summary reports for a bot

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The report month to fetch (format YYYY-MM). Defaults to the latest report.
